{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3387269,"name":"Youngmoo Kim","username":"ProfessorY","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-16T20:58:44.518Z","cooked":"

As we head into summer and the long (hot?) FRC 2024 offseason, Team 1218 is releasing our Crescendo competition code. This season, we built on top of Team 6328’s advanced swerve template (for higher frequency odometry readings), which fully utilizes their awesome AdvantageKit replay framework. Our code also incorporates PhotonVision for AprilTag-based 3d pose estimation and odometry integration. The full release includes all robot code for the swerve drive, arm, shooter, climb, and vision systems, but we’ve also published a swerve+vision template with just the code for those two systems (as a potentially simpler starting point).

We’re especially proud of the following features that really helped us during the season:

  • A NavX2 gyro implementation for AdvantageKit and integration with Team 6328’s advanced swerve template (gyro and drive readings at 250 Hz, greatly improving position accuracy, especially during autonomous).
    ** 6328’s template already includes full PathPlanner support.
  • Full PhotonVision integration with the AdvantageKit IO architecture, incorporating AprilTag estimates from four cameras (and four co-processors)
  • (Reasonably) accurate distance shooting using purely pose estimation.

The full code for our 2024 Crescendo bot can be found here:

GitHub

GitHub - VulcanRobotics/Beta2024: Team 1218 new code repository for FRC 2024...

Team 1218 new code repository for FRC 2024 season. Contribute to VulcanRobotics/Beta2024 development by creating an account on GitHub.

And the code for our swerve + vision template can be found here: GitHub - VulcanRobotics/1218Swerve: Swerve drive using AdvantageKit, custom photonvision system, and helpful drive commands.

Please feel free to ask us about how/why we did certain things in our code, and we would welcome any suggestions for how we could improve our organization, logic, structure, etc.

Happy FRC offseason to all!
